text:
Add the possiblity to hide documents in the navigation. (live and authoring area) 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
- If a new document is created  you will be able to determine whether a document should 
be visible in the navigation or not (default -> yes) 
- A new attribute will be added to the node elment in the sitetree, saying whether the 
document is visible or not. 
- Node, which have not set the visibility attribute will be visible by default (compatibility to 
older versions) 
- A document which is not visible in the navigation is nevertheless visible in the site area 
- This attribute will be added to the live sitetree id the document is published 
 
Notes: 
---------- 
- if you have set the visibilty is can not changed anymore via UI. I propose to implement 
it using a new menu entry as e.g. "change document visibility". 
- Other tasks updating sitetree nodes as e.g. copy/paste a document will make the 
document visible again.

Can the patch be applied for 1.2.1 ?

I added a new attachment (svn diff using eclipse). Note, that there are two new
files included in this patch. The first attachment (09/22/04 07:31) is obsolete.

This patch deals with the visibility of a node in the navigation (i.e. it will
be possible to hide nodes in the navigation as asked for by different users).

A short description of the features included in this patch:
- while creating a new document decide whether a document is visible in the
navigation.
- A Node, which have not set the visibility attribute will be visible by default
(compatibility to older versions).
- A document which is not visible in the navigation is nevertheless visible in
the site area
- The visibility attribute is passed to the live area
- There is a menu entry to change the visibility
- This change set the workflow state to authoring.

I tested the solution in some detail. It would therefore be nice if one of the
committers can check the code
and if it is ok apply the patch to one of the next releases.
